    SupplyChain365 Portal component

    TABLE OF CONTENTS

    Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Portal License management User management Environment management Manage mobile Android devices Manage label printers Manage label layouts Manage access for partners (collaborate & exchange) License and services consumption Invoices & payments

    Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Portal In the Supplychain365 portal, administrative matters can be carried out by a user with administrative rights. It provides insight into consumption and active licenses. It is also possible to manage licenses, users, mobile devices, printers, label layouts and access for external partners.

    License management Manage SupplyChain365 licenses. Increase or decrease the number of licenses actually needed for mobile users and modules in the SupplyChain365 admin portal on a daily basis.

    User management Manage SupplyChain365 portal users for management tasks (Admin) and common tasks (Users).

    Environment management Manage Business Central environments (Production & Sandboxes) and the connection to SupplyChain365.

    Manage mobile Android devices Add mobile devices and connect them to SupplyChain365 for warehouse workers and drivers.

    Manage label printers Add label printers that are used in the organization to use in the logistics process.

    Manage label layouts Manage and edit printing label layouts from License Plate labels to serial number lists.

    Manage access for partners (collaborate & exchange) Add External Users to SupplyChain365 Chain partners (customers and suppliers) and give them access to your partner portal to collaborate digitally.

    License and services consumption View the consumption of SupplyChain365 licenses and API services at any time and view monthly overviews.

    Invoices & payments Insight into the invoices and payments of the current (estimate) and months in the past from the consumption of modules and licenses.

    We use cookies to try and give you a better experience in Supplychain365.

    You can learn more about what kind of cookies we use, why, and how from our Privacy policy. If you hate cookies, or are just on a diet, you can disable them altogether too. Just note that the Freshdesk service is pretty big on some cookies (we love the choco-chip ones), and some portions of Freshdesk may not work properly if you disable cookies.
